capital of a political entity
Accountability - local government finance
Time-share and tour guide regulations adopted.

comment.narrative: -Tourism has been selected as a potential growth sector to increase job opportunities for the poor, particularly in rural areas. -Designs of two major tourist development areas prepared; major components of relevant laws formulated and validated
Training of Trainers (TOT) package developed and pilot tested in 5 provinces
Capacity developed for 11 tourism professions across 5 provinces
Tourist-oriented behaviors induced among students (primary and secondary education)
Nation-wide surveys conducted for school curricula review to accommodate tourism dimensions and heritage preservation aspects

title.narrative: Capacity Development of Ministry of Water and Electricity staff

description.narrative: Providing Capacity Development to Ministry of Water and Electricity staff in terms of IWRM, for sustainable development

name.narrative: Wizarat al Miyah wa al Kahraba’

description.narrative: administrative facility
Accountability - local government finance
Develop national water resources Monitoring programme and establishment and mapping of well field protection zones.

comment.narrative: A number of detailed studies of ground water resources assessment completed
Capacity Development on IWIS with more focus on modernization of mathematical models

1) National Water Atlas and Water Resources Data acquisition and validation from all major groundwater resources studies and for all aquifers in the Kingdom. Graphic transformation of these data in a set of approx. 120 maps plus tables for the National Water Atlas. The maps cover the top of the aquifers, their thickness, hydrogeological potential, hydrochemistry including temperature and salinity, and some other aspects. Additionally, groundwater prospect areas for future water abstraction and management are shown. 2) Capacity Building Advice and guidance through the terminal stages of two major groundwater resources projects. Review of all volumes of both projects (33 volumes). Final quality control after submission of the revised versions.

To link the National Water Strategy with Agricultural Strategy, create an opportunity to dedicate the integration of the water sector and the agricultural sector through the formulation and setting goals and policies

Due to MEWA’s initiatives, efficient water use and governance in the municipal and irrigation subsector, reuse of wastewater and exploitation of shallow aquifers caused significant reduction of groundwater abstractions. In addition a set of bolstering measures towards sustainable water supply even in stress and emergency situations and minimizing the climatically induced environmental risks has been formulated

description.narrative: MOT is aiming at developing sustainable transport systems and improving road safety. The project addresses two activity fields: (i) Strengthening governance through NTS reporting and review, and (ii) Capacity building for road and transport safety.

document-link.url: https://info.undp.org/docs/pdc/Documents/SAU/111019 MOT - Signed LPAC meeting minutes - SIS.pdf
https://info.undp.org/docs/pdc/Documents/SAU/131126 Signed Substantive Project and Budget Revision - AS.pdf

description.narrative: Technical assistance to the Ministry of Transport to support the implementation of the National Transport Strategy and Intelligent Transport System.
administrative facility
Quality of transport policies and level of inter-agency coordination -Level of public transport services and use of Intelligent Transport Systems -Level of road safety and eco-friendly transport

comment.narrative: -Lack of national transport strategy to guide sector activities as focus for inter-agency coordination -No public transport in cities, and ITS capacities not developed -High levels of road death rates and high levels of vehicle pollution levels
Follow-up on the Implementation of the NTS with more focus on national model for passengers and freight, and the assessment of transport data and KPI.

Although the publication of the National Transformation Programme (NTP2020) Initiatives changed priorities for National Transport Strategy (NTS) related activities, nevertheless, the project managed to combine the multimodal logistic development plan with the national Transport Infrastructure plan and developed general Master plan for Saudi Arabia. A support provided for the preparation of the National Maritime Safety Program and the implementation of related IMO conventions. Prepared a report with the overview of best practices regarding Transport Laws and Governance systems to prepare the Terms of Reference for the implementation of a new Transport Law for Saudi Arabia. The final report on ITS design for Dammam Highway Traffic Management System has been approved by MOT.

To focus on the implementation of 3 initiatives of NTP 2020 related to the road sector: Road Safety Program to Reduce Fatalities, Revenue Generation from Road Assets and Road Lifecycle Cost and Performance Optimization by design the new procurement regulation related to introducing the Performance-Based Road Asset Management and Maintenance Contracts and design the standardized contract’s structure including road maintenance cost per KM (routine and preventive)

The improving methods of estimating capital and operating costs for new project in NTP 2.0 has been formulated with focus in assessing data collection approach and analysis techniques. The dashboard for the accident analysis has been improved and reflected new method of safety parameters calculation and presented differently.

description.narrative: This is the first phase (2011-2013) in the framework of a six-year (2011-2017) capacity building programme for the Ministry of Economy and Planning, aimed at supporting the recently published Ninth National Development Plan (NDP; 2010-14).

document-link.url: https://info.undp.org/docs/pdc/Documents/SAU/00062337_110816 Signed English PD for SAU10-79795 - YY.pdf

1. Improved regional databases to measure development patterns 2. Action plan developed for local development agencies 3. Success indicators for each sector at the regional level formulated 3. Planning tools (GIS) enhanced and operational 4. Qualify of life indicators produced at the regional level 5. Green economy case study produced for one province

comment.narrative: Balanced regional development is the major objective of the five-year planning process
1. Strategic Support Unit established 3. Long-Term Strategy reviewed through conducting 11 thematic studies. 3. Mathematical models updated to test consistency of sectoral strategies and policies

Sustainable Development concept integrated into development policies (social and environmental aspects), including the two dimensions of diversification of the economic base and of boosting the competitiveness of the national economy
Comprehensive study on dimensions of development sustainability at 13 regions of Saudi Arabia

description.narrative: This project is formulated with the key objective of providing advisory and technical services to Riyadh Urban Observatory in its pursuit to align urban and governance indicators with the international standards; to produce local set of indicators; and to develop the national capacities required for sustainable functioning beyond the duration of the project.
capital of a political entity
Riyadh Urban Observatory database updated and operational

comment.narrative: Riyadh Urban Observatory already established, although inactive
National capacity developed to sustain urban indicators’ database and generalize its products among sectors in Riyadh
Urban indicators’ database updated; however urban indicators were not fully utilized for sectoral policy-making due to unexpected delay in cost-sharing in 2016.

description.narrative: The second phase of a capacity development programme for the new Saudi Energy Efficiency Centre to develop Energy Efficiency Policy and Regulations

document-link.url: https://info.undp.org/docs/pdc/Documents/SAU/140120 Signed Substantive Project and Budget Revision - 2014 - ٍِ.pdf

description.narrative: Technical assistance to King Abdul-Aziz City for Science and Technology in terms of Energy Efficiency .
capital of a political entity
Energy - power generation
National Strategy Submitted to SEEC Board

comment.narrative: The Center is established and the Energy Efficiency Laws is drafted
National Energy Efficiency Strategic Plan completed, and number of engineers and technicians are certified from accredited energy institutions and qualify national trainers in EE field.

Through mechanisms currently available, the project has been able to activate quick initiatives to rationalize energy consumption in three different sectors namely building, transportation and industry. Each initiative was being developed with the participation of an integrated national system, taking into account the preservation of the governmental authorities. The project managed to determine the current level of energy efficiency. The project conducted number of training programmes and specialized workshops in the field of rationalization and raising the efficiency of energy consumption in all cities of the kingdom.
To contribute in reducing the energy intensity for targeted sectors, enhancing policies and strategy for sustainable use of natural resources, and continue increasing energy efficiency awareness .

The program developed a mechanism for Energy Consumption performance indicators in the Kingdom for measurement and evaluation Performance at the national (gross) and sectoral level, they can be classified into three sections: • Develop two indicators at the national level, illustrate Energy efficiency performance across the economy Of the Kingdom and energy consumption per capita. • Develop seven indicators to measure the performance of sectors Industry, buildings and transport. • Thirty-six (36) indicators were developed for use Which measures the performance of program initiatives Energy efficiency. These Target indicators were selected based on Global practices in the field, in coordination with the authorities With competence such as the General Organization for Statistics and the Regulatory Authority Electricity, dual production, etc. In Addition a sustainable methodology for data exchange and coordination with entities to be measured in the coming years has also been developed
To increase energy efficiency awareness and introduce energy efficient technologies available on local market. Conduct Awareness campaigns for more than 250 schools and 70,000 student.

title.narrative: Support Saudi Food and Drug Authority second strategic plan

description.narrative: SFDA recently developed its second strategic plan from 2012 to 2016 which focuses mainly on building broad and deep capabilities, ensure thoroughness, transparency, and consistency in enforcement and communication, and complete the coverage of all relevant areas. Where this project documents with the technical assistant of UNDP focuses on the following outputs; 1- Capacity development of SFDA; 2- Ensure thoroughness, transparency, and consistency in enforcement and communication; 3- Complete the coverage of all relevant areas as per SFDA’s mandate; 4- Develop systems and processes to improve
capital of a political entity
Accountability - local government finance
Number of experts visits to support SFDA in building broad and deep capabilities

comment.narrative: None
To develop regulations and specifications in the all sectors system. Training need assessment conducted

Project collaboration resulting in setting of new procedures for such products i.e. herbal tea for babies in collaboration with drug sector and risk team in food sector; connecting the central laboratory with all Port laboratories, which accelerated the speed of the examinations. Capacities of the SFDA were strengthened also through training of ten inspectors have been trained on manufacturing of Biopharmaceuticals. The SFDA lab has achieved 78% in regards to ISO accreditation. Finally, Track and Trace system has been established for monitoring of inventory. Signed agreement with USP to start a training center in the new drug lab building which will provide different training courses for lab staff. The Electronic system is completed (100%); system is running live and available for all local food manufacturers on the SFDA website.
25% of systems, processes & legislations to improve pro-activity in Food Safety, Pesticides, & Animal Feed completed and Standards, control systems and policies developed

6 Guidelines have been updated Monoclonal Antibodies and Related products Quality; Guidelines on Biosimilars; Production and Quality Control of Antisera; production and Quality Control of Allergenic Products; Production and Quality Control of Vaccines and Guidelines for the Production and Quality Control of Blood Products. Moreover about 149 files new registration, variation and renewal haven evaluated.
To develop Systems and processes to improve the pro-active management of emerging risks.

title.narrative: Capacity Development for Warif to Promote Volunteerism

description.narrative: Institutional and individual capacities developed towards promotion of Youth volunteerism
The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent of financial sustainability of social protection systems

The present project represents a unique partnership between an NGO (Warif) and the UNDP with the objective of increasing youth participation in the national development processes. Youth participation in development is perceived to sustain the national development results while ensuring that such development is inclusive and participatory in a meaningful way. The project is envisaged to compliment recent public-sector efforts, which are mainly UNDP-supported, to strategically approach issues of youth participation in development. The project embraces three key outputs: 1) Warif’s institutional
first-order administrative division
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
At least three themes targeted in the organizational and indiviual capacity development programme for potential focus of Warif

comment.narrative: Warif established in 2011 with massive mandate and limited organizational and individual capacities.

comment.narrative: Lack of a clear policy or accredited programmes in the field of education evaluation
Development of systems, regulations, policies, procedures of public education evaluation system

The National Standard framework for teachers in Saudi Arabia has been developed and the professional Standards and licensing strategy plan completed. A number of trainings were conducted to develop the capacity for PEEC staff and education community. Building educator capacity for development and implementation of national teacher standards and licensing. The accrediting system for practitioners and teachers has been developed. Promulgation and media plan was carried out to support spreading awareness.
Professional Development Programme for evaluator is finalized and second batch of the training programme is completed

The General Reference National Framework for Curriculum Standards was generated. Three workshops were conducted to enhance the capacity for the national in the areas of Arabic Language Curriculum Framework, Art Education Curriculum Framework and Computer and Technology Curriculum Framework
Standards-related teacher support tools developed and Teacher licensing regulation finalized and approved
